title: Regarding "chroma packs"
body:
edit: some people asked for a video, I made another chroma (that I'm actually happy with and will be using) for a video, complete with particles and everything. My friend told me that Riot said that editing particles was impossible or very hard to do but it's actually _literally the easiest part._

http://puu.sh/h5XlB/d76a9e206a.png

http://puu.sh/h5XnC/1522238663.png 
http://puu.sh/h5Xo3/a493c88647.png

edit again: the same friend told me to do a blue zac one and to put it here too so here you go, this one literally took less than 5 minutes ಠ__ಠ

http://puu.sh/h5SjV/571f8844e8.png

http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/general-pbe-feedback/FOhsMJB0-introducing-chroma-packs

http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/page/frequently-asked-questions-about-chromas-packs

"The community has been asking for recolors for a long while, but despite testing and experimenting with a few internal ideas, we couldn’t find a way to build them that satisfied our high standards. The current price reflects the work we put into crafting them.

Yeah, it’s possible to do a quick and dirty overlay, or shift a slider left in an editing program, but we think you would call us on that bullshit real quick, and as players ourselves, we wouldn’t be satisfied with such a hacky solution."

You were right, Riot. This is in fact bullshit.

I've done my own recolours before, both the base skin and the particles. I wish I could find screenshots. (Update, see below)

It looked just as "professional" as Riot's provided screenshots, and you know what? It took me an hour to do. And I'd never done it before.

Riot are showing their greed. You could sit down the coffee intern who has no art training at all at a computer with photoshop and all the skin textures, come back in a week and he could have _easily_ made three recolours of each skin in the game.

If they made it unlockable through champion mastery, which is currently terrible (CHAMP SUMMONER ICONS. RIOT. ARE YOU DEAF.), it would be a good feature. Or even IP.

But charging money for a level of effort equivalent to changing the name of a folder? Yeah no, Riot.

Updated: I went into Photoshop and messed around with a random skin (happened to be Foxfire Ahri, in hindsight I should have picked someone with more... visible clothing like Twisted Fate for example, or even Anivia or something), like literally scribbled here and there without caring too much. 

They can claim it takes effort all they want but the simple fact is that I have no training in doing this, spent less than half an hour, and basically made a "chroma" which they want to charge us for. 

I picked completely random colours, I can do the particles too if you'd like. They take even less time than the actual skin itself, literally all you have to do is use the colour replacement tool and scribble all over it.

Every model in the game includes a bitmap like the one in the first image, and every surface on that model has a set of coordinates telling it which part of that bitmap corresponds with that section of the model. There is likely a reasonable amount of QA and overhead that goes into this (research into the right champions/skins for chromas, overhead for picking color palettes, making everything perfect rather than scribbles, etc.), but even when including all of that stuff this is pretty damning.  If it takes a complete novice less than an hour to create a chroma for a reasonably complex champion (art-wise), this becomes reeeeeally questionable.

---

Math!

Let's say there are five main parts to this development process:

* Research
* Recolor
* Assessment/QA
* Iteration
* Release

I'm going to use extremely rough numbers and probably be way off base, but I'm going to err on the side of overboard because it paints a better picture (cwutididthar).  Let's assume each step of the process requires the following work:

* Research - 5 people, 40 hours each
* Recolor - 1 person, 8 hours
* Assessment/QA - 3 people, 40 hours each
* Iteration - 10 people, 40 hours each
* Release - 5 people, 8 hours each

This works out to a total of 768 hours, though I would be pretty surprised if a single Chroma pack took this many man-hours to complete seeing as the OP did it in half an hour.  Let's also assume that everyone working on this project was paid an average of $40 an hour, or roughly an $80k salary per person.  This works out to a total cost of $30,720 for each chroma pack, and assuming each chroma pack costs $5 in RP Riot requires 6,144 sales.  

Assuming a community of 50 million people (it's much higher by official numbers, but whatever let's make the numbers look as good as possible for Riot), this is about 0.0001% of the population, or about a tenth of the number of people in Diamond in North America.  I would be very surprised if that sale percentage isn't feasible from Riot's perspective, selling six thousand units of a desirable product to a population of 50 million people really shouldn't be that difficult.

TLDR, here are the numbers as per above:

* 768 total man-hours for a set of chromas
* $40 cost per hour
* $30,720 total cost
* 6,144 sales to break even

---

Riot needs to make money, and I get that these cosmetics are the main source of revenue for the entire company, but it's a little concerning that either a simple recolor takes such an extraordinarily long time that it warrants this cost or the profit margin is so astronomically high.
